title: Australia sues Microsoft over AI-linked subscription price hikes
byline: Australia’s competition regulator on Monday sued Microsoft, accusing it of misleading millions of customers into paying higher prices for its Microsoft 365 software after bundling it with artificial intelligence tool Copilot.

title: Major US airports face ground stops and flight delays amid ongoing government shutdown
byline: Major airports across the US issued ground stops or delays Sunday amid the ongoing federal government shutdown.

title: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau make public appearance together
byline: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau have made their first public appearance as a couple.

title: 3,500MT of ‘Ponni Samba’ rice imported to Sri Lanka
byline: A total of 3,500 metric tons of ‘Ponni Samba’ rice have been imported into the country, the Sri Lanka Customs has stated.

title: Several spells of showers expected today in parts of the island
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in Northern, North-central, Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts.

title: Island-wide anti-drug operation to commence this week
byline: The island-wide anti-drug operation is scheduled to commence on Thursday (30), Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala has stated.

title: Cyclone Montha to make landfall in India tomorrow
byline: Cyclone Montha, which is likely to intensify into a cyclonic storm today, is expected to make landfall on the coast of Andhra Pradesh, India this evening (27), with wind speeds touching 90-100 km/hour.

title: Indian national arrested at BIA with over 2kg of heroin
byline: A foreign passenger who arrived at the Katunayake International Airport carrying a stock of heroin valued at Rs. 34 million has been arrested by officers of the Customs Narcotics Control Division.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Northern, North-central, Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in the Galle and Matara districts today (27), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Nepal’s PM names popular volunteer, doctor to cabinet
byline: Nepal’s Prime Minister Sushila Karki on Sunday expanded her interim cabinet which was formed in the wake of a youth-led uprising last month, inducting two ministers seen as popular among young people.

title: Nearly 30,000 individuals inspected during special police operation
byline: A total of 781 individuals have been arrested on suspicion of being involved in criminal activities and also over illicit liquor and drug-related offenses during a special island-wide operation conducted yesterday (26).

title: Amber weather advisory issued for strong winds in several provinces
byline: An ‘Amber’ weather advisory has been issued for strong winds for the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern, Northern, North-central and North-western provinces and the Trincomalee and Batticaloa districts by the Department of Meteorology.

title: Police sergeant dies in road accident in Wellawaya
byline: An individual has died in a road accident that occurred along the Wellawaya- Thanamalwila main road in Adawelayaya, Wellawaya.

title: India resumes direct flights to Chinese mainland after 5 years
byline: India on Sunday night resumed direct flights to the Chinese mainland after a five-year hiatus, Indian officials said.

title: Indian national arrested at BIA with nearly 3kg of heroin
byline: A foreign passenger who arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport carrying a stock of heroin valued at Rs. 34 million, has been arrested.

title: Rumesh Tharanga claims gold in Men’s javelin throw at South Asian Athletics C’ships
byline: Sri Lanka’s Rumesh Tharanga claimed the gold medal in the Men’s javelin throw event at the South Asian Athletics Championships 2025 at the Birsa Munda Athletics Stadium, Morabadi, Ranchi.

title: Man arrested with over 196kg of Kerala cannabis in Dompe
byline: An individual has been arrested with a stock of Kerala cannabis during a special raid conducted by a team of officers from the Police Special Task Force (STF).

title: Rumesh Tharanga named Best Male Athlete at South Asian Athletics Championships
byline: Sri Lanka’s javelin champion Rumesh Tharanga has been adjudged the Best Male Athlete at the fourth South Asian Athletics Championships held in Ranchi, India.

title: Ukraine targets Moscow with dozens of drones, Russia says
byline: Russian air defences shot down dozens of Ukrainian drones heading to Moscow and downed nearly 160 more over other regions in attacks that killed at least one and injured five others, Russian officials said on Monday.

title: Special project to reduce landslides along Bibile -Passara road launched
byline: The National Building Research Organization (NBRO) has announced a joint programme with the Road Development Authority (RDA) to launch a specialized project aimed at mitigating landslide risks along the Bibile -Passara road.

title: Sri Lanka and Australia sign bilateral debt restructuring agreements
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka and the Government of Australia have entered into bilateral agreements on external debt restructuring, marking a significant milestone in Sri Lanka’s ongoing efforts to restore debt sustainability and revamp its economy.

title: India evacuates tens of thousands as cyclone Montha gains strength
byline: India moved 50,000 people to relief camps on Monday (Oct 27) as it began evacuations a day before Cyclone Montha, intensifying over the Bay of Bengal, is set to bring strong winds and heavy rains to its east coast, officials said.

title: Argentina’s midterm election hands decisive win to Milei’s libertarian overhaul
byline: Argentine President Javier Milei’s party cruised to victory in midterm legislative elections as voters handed him a mandate to keep pushing through his radical overhaul of the economy despite widespread discontent with his deep austerity measures.

title: Steps will be taken to grant voting rights to Sri Lankans working abroad: FM
byline: Steps will be taken in the future to grant voting rights to Sri Lankans working abroad, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism, Vijitha Herath has stated.

title: Kuwait Airways resumes direct flights to Sri Lanka
byline: Kuwait Airways on Monday launched direct flights to Colombo after two years of codeshare operations.

title: Jaffna named one of the best places to visit in 2026 by Lonely Planet
byline: Jaffna has been named as one of the Top 25 Best Places to Visit in the World for 2026, by global travel publication Lonely Planet.

title: Trump gets royal welcome in Japan, China trade truce hopes rise
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump received a royal welcome on Monday in Japan, the latest leg of a five-day Asia trip which he hopes to cap with an agreement on a trade war truce with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

title: Suspected shooter in Weligama PS Chairman’s murder produced before JMO
byline: The suspected shooter in connection with the murder of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekara, who was arrested in Nawinna last evening (26), has been produced before the Colombo Judicial Medical Officer this afternoon (27).

title: Woman murders 3-year-old son before taking own life
byline: A woman has reportedly murdered her own child and then committed suicide by hanging herself in the Kahatapitiya area of Batapola.

title: World’s oldest president, Cameroon’s Paul Biya, wins re-election at 92
byline: Cameroon’s top court on Monday declared incumbent Paul Biya, the world’s oldest president, the winner of the Oct. 12 election. Clashes with security forces left at least four protesters dead ahead of the announcement as opposition supporters rallied to demand credible results.

title: Hand grenade found in front of house in Wellampitiya
byline: A hand grenade has been discovered in the road in front of house at a housing complex located on Donald Perera Mawatha in Wellampitiya.

title: Weligama PS chairman murder: 72-hour detention orders obtained on 6 suspects
byline: Sri Lanka Police has been allowed to detain for 72 hours the six suspects, including the suspected gunman and the motorcycle rider arrested over the killing of Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Lasantha Wickremasekara, for further questioning.

title: Ghana court grants bail to 11 accused of defrauding Sri Lankan MP in $2 million ‘gold scam’ - report
byline: The Accra Circuit Court Eight has granted bail to eleven persons accused of defrauding a Sri Lankan Member of Parliament of USD2 million under the pretext of supplying gold, according to Ghanian media reports.
